numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Legacy applicants consistently have a higher chance of being accepted.
2. Legacy applicants often have parents with a higher income.
3. I wonder why a college automatically accepts a person who has parents with a higher income.
4. A student can have parents with a lower income.
5. A student who has parents with a lower income may be a better fit for a school than a student who has parents with a higher income.
6. If a person is a legacy applicant then it does not mean that this person is as academic as a previous generation.
7. This situation relates to my community.
9. Many children in Dallas hope to pursue academics in college.
10. These children will be very privileged in their choices of colleges.
